FacilityName: Resers Fine Foods, Inc. - Century Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.    EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1.1.    Accidental Release Prevention And Emergency Response Policies

1.1.1.    The Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. Century Plant refrigeration system located at 6999 Century Blvd. Hillsboro, OR uses pure anhydrous ammonia (a frequently used refrigerant for industrial   systems) as the refrigerant. Due to the quantity of anhydrous ammonia, it is considered a hazardous substance by the EPA. Several of the properties that make ammonia advantageous as a refrigerant also requires that detailed precautions and procedures be put in place to protect employee and public health and their safety during a chemical emergency. It is the policy of Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. to be in compliance with all applicable federal and state rules and regulations.    

1.1.2.    Safety at our facility is inherent on the manner in which anhydrous ammonia is managed.  While the design of the facility incorporates a variety of safety devices, safe handling procedures combined with appropriate training of our personnel and contractors are key aspects to maintaining safety at our facility.

1.1.3.    We have a written Process Safety Management (PSM) plan that complies with state and federal regulations. A crucial component of this plan is the Emergency Response Plan, developed in compliance with the Emergency Response provisions. The Emergency Response Plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordinating with outside parties. This enables those who deal with emergencies to have a course of action to effectively deal with unplanned events.



1.2.    Facility Description And Substances Handled

1.2.1.    Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. is a food manufacturing facility that stores and distributes refrigerated foods. Production requires the use of one refrigeration system to preserve the integrity of processed foods. These refrigeration processes use ammonia as a refrigerant. Access to the facility is restricted to authorized employees and visitors, management personnel, and contractors.

1.2.2.    The regula

ted substance managed at this facility is anhydrous ammonia.

1.2.3.    The ammonia refrigeration system maximum inventory is 38,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. There is no standby make-up inventory kept on-site.

1.3.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program And Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 

1.3.1.    Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations. The design and construction of this facility was in accordance with published standards, tests or recommended methods of trade, industry or governmental organizations.  

1.3.2.    Reser's written PSM plan incorporates policies and procedures to ensure safe operation and regular maintenance of this facility. This plan will be reviewed and updated as necessary by the Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. Risk Management Department. 











1.3.3.    Training is provided to ensure that each employee involved in operating a process has been trained and understands an overview of the process, the operating procedures, and safety considerations. Only qualified and authorized personnel shall operate and interact with the refrigeration system. This will minimize the chances of an inadvertent error in operation that could lead to an unintended release of ammonia. Startup, shutdown, and any on-stream adjustments are handled only by these qualified and authorized persons.  



1.4.    Five-Year Accident History

1.4.1.    There has been no significant release of ammonia at the Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. Hillsboro, OR Century facility.



1.5.    Emergency Response Program

1.5.1.    Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. has a written Emergency Response Plan developed to ensure that precautions and procedures are in place to protect employee and public health and safety during a chemical emergency. It shall comply with provisions Emergency Response regulations. The Emergency Response Plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordinating with outside parties. This enables those who d

eal with emergencies to have a course of action to effectively deal with unplanned events.  This plan will undergo review with the local emergency services first responding agency.

1.5.2.    The approach in the development of this plan has been to identify the ammonia emergencies most likely to occur at Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. and establish precautions and procedures to protect life safety and health during an emergency.  The refrigeration process has back-up prevention systems to keep processing malfunctions from becoming ammonia release emergencies

1.5.3.    All Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. personnel will be trained to fulfill their designated responsibilities in an emergency. Mock emergency drills will be held periodically to maintain familiarity with response actions and identify plan elements requiring improvement.

1.5.4.    This plan will be reviewed and updated as necessary by the Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. Risk Management Department.



1.6.    Planned Changes To Improve Safety

1.6.1.    This is a new site.
